Actual position of the current cycle in the axis coordinate system		 get

ushort ChannelNumber
Return the number of the channel to which the axis is assigned, or 0 if unassigned.		 get
int CommandedPositionACS
Command position of current cycle in the axis coordinate system.		 get
double CurrentFeedrate get
sbyte Direction get
int EndPositionACS
Target position in the current NC block, ACS. This represents the target position of the program coordinate system referred to the axes. It is valid only as long as no transformation is active. Currently, the target position is not transformed back onto the axes.		 get
bool HomingDone get
bool InPosition get
uint Mode get
AxisState State
Even if an axis is not moved in the PCS, a corresponding Cartesian or kinematic transformation may nevertheless execute a motion of the physical axis.
Example: 90° rotation about Z; Y is moved if X is programmed.		 get
ushort Type get

ActualPositionACS

public int ActualPositionACS { get; }
Summary

Actual position of the current cycle in the axis coordinate system

EndPositionACS

public int EndPositionACS { get; }
Summary

Target position in the current NC block, ACS. This represents the target position of the program coordinate system referred to the axes. It is valid only as long as no transformation is active. Currently, the target position is not transformed back onto the axes.

public double ActiveFeedrate { get; }

InPosition

public bool InPosition { get; }

HomingDone

public bool HomingDone { get; }

State

public AxisState State { get; }
Summary

Even if an axis is not moved in the PCS, a corresponding Cartesian or kinematic transformation may nevertheless execute a motion of the physical axis. Example: 90° rotation about Z; Y is moved if X is programmed.

ChannelNumber

public ushort ChannelNumber { get; }
Summary

Return the number of the channel to which the axis is assigned, or 0 if unassigned.
